report_title: Floor Covering Stores in the US Industry Report
executive_summary: Floor covering stores derives their demand from two massive downstream markets. Residential and nonresidential markets play a pivotal role in the growth of floor covering stores. Over the past five years, the COVID-19 pandemic hit the nonresidential market hard, as businesses were forced to close, and employees had to work from home whenever possible. This slowdown in business activity depressed any further growth seen by the industry. At the same time, more consumers remaining at home caused a jump in spending on home improvements and housing starts. Thus, the strong demand stemming from the residential market drove revenue growth through 2020.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demand for Flooring Grew During the COVID-19 Pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Over the past five years, the residential sector has experienced rapid demand, stemming from historically low interest rates throughout most of the five years. Even through 2020, as COVID-19 swept through the United States, demand for flooring remained heightened. High per capita disposable income met with increased investment into home improvement bolstered demand for flooring as well.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Declines in Nonresidential Activity Harmed Industry Performance
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Beginning in 2020, as COVID-19 disruptions took their place, the US government forced most businesses to close, and most workers were required to work from home if possible. As a result, activity in the nonresidential markets plummeted since companies went fully online, and no businesses were looking to expand.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Growing Presence of Big-Box Stores Limited Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Because floor covering stores operate within the larger home improvement market, retailers are in direct competition with nationwide stores like Lowe's and the Home Depot. These stores have a considerably larger presence than floor covering stores, making it difficult for operators to fully capitalize on the bolstered growth from the residential market, limiting revenue growth as a result.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rising Interest Rates are Expected to Crush Downstream Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The two crucial downstream market indicators for floor covering stores are residential and nonresidential. With interest rates anticipated to remain high, activity in residential and nonresidential markets will slow to a crawl. With interest rates growing, financing a mortgage, borrowing money and building a new office all become more costly to the consumer or business.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rising Competition Will Likely Prevent Growth Moving Forward
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The largest threat for floor covering stores is the encroachment of big-box home improvement stores like the Home Depot and Lowe's. These stores have nationwide dominance and are a one-stop shop for most home improvement needs. In addition to the large selection and presence of these stores, they also offer a fleet of experts who can install new flooring.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Growing Disposable Income is Expected to Offset Further Declines
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Another crucial indicator of demand is per capita disposable income levels. Many of the negative macroeconomic trends plaguing the consumer in the period are expected to diminish. As a result, per capita disposable income is expected to grow. Although interest rates are set to crush downstream demand for most floor covering products, this jump in disposable income may push consumers to upgrade their current floor coverings for something of higher quality.

industry_definition: Establishments in this industry retail carpets, rugs, tiles and vinyl flooring. Most operators manage sales and administrative activities, such as customer service, product merchandising, advertising, inventory control and cash handling. Some operators also offer installation or repair services.

key_trends: Heightened competition is still on the line, as Lowe's and the Home Depot have only gotten larger during the period.
Rising interest rates present a massive problem for the industry. Demand from the residential and nonresidential markets will bear the brunt of the rate hikes.
Falling nonresidential activity depressed revenue growth in 2020 and is expected to remain low through the end of the period.
The COVID-19 pandemic led to a boost in residential demand for floor coverings as consumers looked to invest heavily in their homes during the stay-at-home orders.
Carpeting and synthetic wood became more popular through the period. As wood prices soared, consumers looked for cheaper alternatives.
During the COVID-19 pandemic, bathroom and kitchen renovations bolstered the demand for tiling, with many consumers doing the renovations themselves.
The Great Lakes and Mid-Atlantic draw more industrial and business clients rather than consumer-focused residential markets in the West and Southeast regions.
